Using Bootstrap with Jekyll

23 Feb 2017


Before starting with this section, if you would like to know ‘How to get started with Jekyll’, click here.

To use bootstrap or any other front end framework, we need to have directory structure as shown here https://jekyllrb.com/docs/structure/

To start with, in index.html under root folder, modify the line layout: home to layout:default

Then, we will add 2 folders _includes and _layouts to root folder.

In _includes folder, create new file scripts.html. We will use Jquery and Bootstrap cdn, so add these scripts

scripts.html

In _layouts, create new file default.html and add the following content.

default.html

And, in the body section of default.html, add

To test bootstrap framework is working, in _includes folder, create another file header.html and add the code below

header.html

Now, in your terminal, run

This will serve up new blog with bootstrap framework. However, this will not show up the posts.

So, just add the code below in index.html,

index.html

Now, you have successfully running Bootstrap enabled Jekyll blog.
